body_content.explanation: the right to have or do something that is limited to only one person or organization:
examples: Newspapers buying a story will pay more for exclusivity.
Sponsors selling their wares at the Olympic Games demanded exclusivity.

body_content.explanation: the quality of being available only to a small number of people who are rich enough or considered good enough:
examples: The exclusivity of the hotel is what attracts some people.
These schools thrive on an image of exclusivity.
Once defined by exclusiveness, luxury is now available to all.

body_content.explanation: the quality in two things of both not being possible at the same time:
examples: Unfortunately, there is some mutual exclusivity between the desire for quick profit and our long-term strategy.
